definitions.definition: used to emphasize that somebody is doing something or using something a lot

examples.text: She's been spending money like it's going out of fashion.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘make, shape, appearance’, also ‘a particular make or style’): from Old French façon, from Latin factio(n-), from facere ‘do, make’.
